title: Power Control of a Modular Three-Port Solid-State Transformer With Three-Phase Unbalance Regulation Capabilities
abstract: Three-phase unbalance issue can cause adverse impacts on the power quality of the solid-state transformer (SST) based AC/DC hybrid microgrid. In this paper, an unbalanced power control strategy for cascaded dual active bridge (DAB) converter is proposed. With the strategy, the transmitted power of each DAB module in each phase is evenly distributed in terms of the three-phase unbalance degree of the three-phase AC grid. Thus, the idea of unequal power sharing in cascaded DAB can be applied to mitigate the three-phase unbalance from the perspective of power control. Moreover, this paper proposed a three-phase unbalance power mitigation algorithm based on the unbalanced power control strategy for the cascaded DAB. The proposed strategy can help the SST realize the function of mitigating three-phase unbalance when it transmits energy to the DC microgrid. Thus, the proposed control strategy can mitigate the three-phase unbalance on the premise that the power demand of the system is met. Finally, the simulations and the experiment results have verified the effectiveness and correctness of the proposed control method.

ABSTRACT Three-phase unbalance issue can cause adverse impacts on the power quality of the solid-state
transformer (SST) based AC/DC hybrid microgrid. In this paper, an unbalanced power control strategy
for cascaded dual active bridge (DAB) converter is proposed. With the strategy, the transmitted power of
each DAB module in each phase is evenly distributed in terms of the three-phase unbalance degree of the
three-phase AC grid. Thus, the idea of unequal power sharing in cascaded DAB can be applied to mitigate the
three-phase unbalance from the perspective of power control. Moreover, this paper proposed a three-phase
unbalance power mitigation algorithm based on the unbalanced power control strategy for the cascaded
DAB. The proposed strategy can help the SST realize the function of mitigating three-phase unbalance when
it transmits energy to the DC microgrid. Thus, the proposed control strategy can mitigate the three-phase
unbalance on the premise that the power demand of the system is met. Finally, the simulations and the
experiment results have veriﬁed the effectiveness and correctness of the proposed control method.
INDEX TERMS Solid-state transformer, microgrid, power control, three-phase unbalance regulation.
I. INTRODUCTION
Solid state transformer (SST) is a novel prototype of power
distribution transformer based on power electronic converter
technology. It can replace the conventional line frequency
transformer, and have ﬂexible controllability and a variety
of AC and DC ports, which can easily and ﬂexibly access
various distributed power sources, power storage equipment,
and AC/DC hybrid microgrid [1]. Therefore, SST is taken
as a fundamental element for the future energy networks,
including energy internet [2]–[5], AC/DC hybrid micro-
grid [6]–[7], distributed generation [8], and electric vehicles
(EVs) [9].
At present, the research on SST topology mainly focuses
on three-level [10], four-level [11], and ﬁve-level [12]–[13]
structures. Among them, the ﬁve-level SST has gained the
most extensive attention and research, with advantages such

as simple ﬁltering circuit, variety of AC and DC ports, easy
modularization, etc. [14].
Due to the limitation of the device voltage rating, it is
usually necessary to use multiple units for series or paral-
lel connection in high/low voltage bus and large capacity
applications [15]. However, the unbalance between voltage
and power is an inherent problem for the series or parallel
connection converter.
For the series or parallel connection SST, plenty of
high/low voltage DC (HVDC/LVDC) bus voltage balance and
power equalization techniques have been explored [16]–[19].
In [16], a simple single-phase d-q vector-based common-
duty-ratio control strategy was proposed for the cascaded
rectiﬁer stage, achieving excellent performance in the light
of power factor and grid side current. Based on [16],
a novel voltage balance control strategy was proposed to
settle the voltage imbalance that could arise to the dc links
of different HVDC bus [17]. In [18], a hybrid modulation
method based on both low- and high-frequency modulation

techniques was proposed for Cascaded H-bridge converters
to achieve DC voltage balance even if in irregular conditions.
For the predigesting modulation algorithm, a master-slave
control (MSC) strategy was scheduled for the cascaded
dual active bridge (DAB) stage [19]. However, these strate-
gies cannot effectively reduce the voltage deviation on the
HVDC/LVDC bus when the load suddenly changes.
In order to reduce the voltage deviation on the
HVDC/LVDC bus, the SST modulation strategy based on
feedforward control has been studied [20]. Meanwhile, direct
power control is one of the most effective methods to improve
the dynamic response speed of power electronic converter.
In [21], a new simple virtual direct power control (VDPC)
strategy, which is ready to be performed as constant fre-
quency control for the DAB converter to improve the dynamic
response, was proposed. The proposed strategy can reach
the target output voltage rapidly and accurately under the
unconventional environment. These strategies have only been
veriﬁed in a single-phase SST, and its application in the series
or parallel connection SST remains to be studied.
In brief, the literature mentioned above only consider the
internal characteristics of SST. When SST is connected to
the DC microgrid, it causes sharp ﬂuctuations in the LVDC
bus voltage, which directly threatens the safe, and stable
operation of the DC microgrid. Therefore, the low inertia DC
microgrid will be a very fragile system. If the dc microgrid
adopts virtual inertia control, the inertia of the dc microgrid
and the ability to suppress the sudden change of dc bus
voltage can be enhanced. In [22], a new bus-signaling strat-
egy was proposed to realize the initiative coordinated prop-
erty of the system based on different state of charge (SoC)
circumstances. Among this, the DC loads perform virtual
inertia control and demand-side control, respectively. In [23],
the virtual synchronous generator (VSG) control strategy was
proposed to restrain dc-side vibration and raise the inertia of
the whole system. In [24], a general virtual inertia control
strategy was proposed and implemented in the wind turbines,
batteries, and utility grid interfaced converters to avoid the
bus voltage ﬂuctuations no matter when the DC microgrid
is operating at the grid-connected mode or at the islanding
mode. In [25], a dc bus voltage ﬂuctuation elimination strat-
egy was proposed by grid-connected converters equipped,
with an analogized virtual synchronous machine (VSM).
However, few papers focus on the virtual inertia control for
SST connected to the DC microgrid [26], [27]. Reference [26]
only discussed the single-phase SST combined with the DC
microgrid. Reference [27] introduced the virtual inertia con-
trol for the output stage of the SST, which cannot be directly
applied to the parallel connection SST. This research devised
the DC microgrid as DC link or subgrid of an AC microgrid,
ignoring the dynamic characteristics of the DC microgrid.
Besides, unbalanced loading is quite common in the SST
enabled grid with the growth of dynamically varying domes-
tic loads. Reference [28] proposed a new unbalance compen-
sation strategy based on reduced order generalized integrator
to suppress the negative-sequence current. Reference [29]
proposed a neutral current minimization control for SST
which could save energy in the distribution cables and reduce
power consumption in the load. However, the existing control
strategies are complicated, which affects the performance of
the SST.
In conclusion, previous control strategies only control the
input or output current to mitigate the three-phase unbal-
ance. In the SST-based AC/DC hybrid microgrid, the power
of the whole system is more concerned than the current
and is needed to be controlled directly. Moreover, previous
three-phase unbalance studies are carried out from the recti-
ﬁer stage or inverter stage. As a multi-stage coupling struc-
ture, the AC/DC hybrid microgrid based on SST should not
only mitigate the three-phase unbalance, but also consider the
dynamic characteristics of other parts to maintain the normal
operation of the system. Therefore, a three-phase unbalance
mitigation algorithm based on the overall system should be
studied.
Thus, the idea of this paper is to mitigate the three-phase
unbalance while transmitting the power required by the sys-
tem from the perspective of power balance. The main contri-
butions of this paper are listed as follows:
• Different from the previous idea that each DAB trans-
mits the same power, this paper proposed an unbalanced
power control algorithm for the cascaded DAB. With the
help of the proposed algorithm for the cascaded DAB,
the transmission power of each DAB can be allocated
according to the three-phase unbalance degree of the
three-phase power grid. Thus, the idea of unequal power
sharing in cascaded DAB can be applied to mitigate the
three-phase unbalance from the perspective of power
control.
• In order to maintain the normal operation of the whole
system, this paper proposed a three-phase unbalance
power mitigation algorithm based on the unbalanced
power control strategy for the cascaded DAB. The pro-
posed strategy can help the SST realize the function
of mitigating three-phase unbalance when it transmits
energy to the DC microgrid. Thus, the proposed control
strategy can mitigate the three-phase unbalance on the
premise that the power demand of the system is met.
This paper is organized as follows: The modeling of the
basic topology and operation scheme of SST are discussed
in Section II. Section III presents how the proposed con-
trol method to solve the problems of power and voltage
distribution strategy. Section IV demonstrates how the pro-
posed method to alleviate the grid three-phase imbalance.
Section V shows the simulation and experimental results
of modular SST-based DC microgrid established in Mat-
lab/Simulink instrument and experimental prototype, respec-
tively. Section VI gives the conclusion.
II. BASIC TOPOLOGY OF MODULAR SST
The demonstrated DC microgrid framework feasibility by
modular SST is shown in Fig. 1. This paper concentrates
upon the power exchange and control issues between the

The parallel rectiﬁer and DAB module of a ﬁve-level SST
is shown in Fig. 2. Each phase of the grid is connected
by a rectiﬁer and a DAB converter. All DAB converters
are connected to a common LVDC bus. The advantage of
this conﬁguration is that the power level of each phase is
reduced, relative to the three-phase connection. Meanwhile,
the modular SST can provide AC bus and DC bus, which
not only offers an interface for grid-connected photovoltaic,
wind power or other new energy equipment to generate
electricity, but also greatly facilitates bidirectional energy
exchange between electric vehicles and the grid. Further-
more, when one of the three phases fails, the other two phases
can continue to work and maintain the normal operation of
the system. Besides, the output topology adopts output-
parallel connection rectiﬁer, then a circulating current is
generated. In the existing literature, there have been many
different methods developed in order to suppress the circu-
lating current. For example, the study in [30] proposed a
zero-sequence circulating-current control strategy by intro-
ducing a variable of the zero-vector duty cycle. The control
strategy in [31] was proposed to suppress the zero-sequence
circulating current based on common dc-link applications.
Since the focus of this paper is not how to eliminate the
circulating current, this paper adopts the method of series
resistance in the line to make the voltage consistent, so that
the circulation can be eliminated to the greatest extent.
In Fig. 2, Uini represents the ith output voltage of the paral-
lel converter, Uo represents the output voltage of the DAB
converters. The DC-links provided in output by the DAB
converters can be connected to loads, storage, and DC sources
separately or can be connected in parallel based on the DC
Smart Grid conﬁguration.
III. OVERALL CONTROL STRATEGY OF MODULAR
SST-BASED DC MICROGRID
The proposed control strategy combines rectiﬁer level con-
trol, DAB level control, and DC microgrid control. The main
objective of rectiﬁer stage control is to maintain HVDC bus
voltage stability and unity power factor. The proposed DAB
level control strategy can realize the transmission of different
power of different DAB modules and simplify the modulation
strategy. Virtual inertial control is adopted for DC microgrid
control, which can not only maintain the stability of the
LVDC bus but also reduce the ﬂuctuation range of LVDC bus
voltage.
A. ANALYSIS OF THE PARALLEL RECTIFIER STAGE
Through application of the three-dimensional space vector
modulation (3-D SVPWM), each phase can be indepen-
dently regulated through the fourth leg, thus control of the
three phase voltages are decoupled. AC/DC conversion stage

ensure that the grid voltage is in phase with the network side
current and the network side current is a sinusoidal wave. The
rapid and stable adjustment of DC bus voltage ensures the
stability of the power exchange between the AC/DC stage and
the DAB stage. However, due to the coupling in the rotating

If PDABb > 1.2Pr , the power is redistributed according to
the method of PDABa >1.2Pr . If the required power of the
DC microgrid exceeds the sum of the rated transmission
power (3.6P r ) of the three DAB converters, then the power
demand of the DC microgrid should be satisﬁed ﬁrst without
considering mitigating the three-phase unbalance.
It is worth mentioning that the three-phase unbalance
control strategy proposed in this paper can only mitigate
the three-phase unbalance but can not completely eliminate
the three-phase unbalance. This is because the power con-
trol strategy proposed in this paper not only mitigates the
three-phase unbalance but also supplies power to the DC
microgrid.
From the above analysis, when three-phase unbalance
occurs in the power grid, according to the current power
required by the DC microgrid, the phase with higher voltage
consumes more power from the grid. Meanwhile, the phase
with lower voltage consumes less power from the grid. Thus,
the three-phase unbalanced power can be adjusted.

V. CONCLUSION
In this paper, a novel unbalance power control strategy for
cascaded DAB in a modular SST is proposed. The proposed
power control method allows different DAB modules to
transmit different power through the module DAB structure.
Thus, the idea of unequal power sharing in cascaded DAB
can be applied to mitigate the three-phase unbalance from
the perspective of power control. Furthermore, a three-phase
unbalance mitigation method based on the DC microgrid
power consumption and the three-phase unbalance degree
is proposed. The proposed control strategy can mitigate the
three-phase unbalance and meet the power demand of the
DC microgrid. The simulation and experiment results have
demonstrated that the proposed strategy can effectively deal
with the unbalance of modular SST-based AC/DC hybrid
microgrid.
